citation.name: J. Cell. Mol. Med.
citation.title: Structural and mechanistic insights into Mps1 kinase activation.

comment.text: Phosphorylates proteins on serine, threonine, and tyrosine. Probably associated with cell proliferation. Essential for chromosome alignment by enhancing AURKB activity (via direct CDCA8 phosphorylation) at the centromere, and for the mitotic checkpoint.
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
Inhibited by the ATP-competitive kinase inhibitor, SP600125.
Interacts with TPR; the interactions occurs in a microtubule-independent manner.
Present in rapidly proliferating cell lines.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Ser/Thr protein kinase family.

property.value: P:positive regulation of pathway-restricted SMAD protein phosphorylation
P:protein localization to meiotic spindle midzone
